instruction: Administered 25 mg of long-acting risperidone in the patient's right arm.

attributes.notes: Administered 25 mg of long-acting risperidone in the patient's right arm.

instruction: Ordered baseline ECG and electrolytes. If potassium dips below four, start potassium chloride 20 mEq after supper daily.

attributes.comment: Monitor heart and electrolyte levels; manage low potassium if needed.

instruction: Remind aides: stand-by assist for walks, slow position changes, record each blood-pressure reading in the binder daily.

attributes.comment: Remind aides: stand-by assist for walks, slow position changes, record each blood-pressure reading in the binder daily.

instruction: Next risperidone injection scheduled for day 28; if daytime drowsiness exceeds two naps, reduce to 12.5 mg.

attributes.sig: Next injection scheduled for day 28; if daytime drowsiness exceeds two naps, reduce to 12.5 mg.

instruction: Daily pulse checks and weekly ECG for the first month to monitor QT interval.

attributes.narrative: Daily pulse checks and weekly ECG for the first month to monitor QT interval.

instruction: Patient experienced dizziness and ringing in ears after taking medication. Hallucinations occur at 3 a.m., causing fear. Concern about QT interval prolongation with current medications.

attributes.narrative: Patient experienced dizziness and ringing in ears after taking medication. Hallucinations occur at 3 a.m., causing fear. Concern about QT interval prolongation with current medications.
